title: Ankhmare
content:
Ankhmare (fl.â€‰c. 2525 BC) was an ancient Egyptian prince and vizier of the 4th Dynasty. His titles include king's eldest son of his body (sA-nswt n Xt=f), as well as chief justice and vizier (smsw tAjtj sAb TAtj).[1] Ankhmare was a son of King Khafre and was named after the god Ra.[2]

His titles include:[3]

Ankhmare's tomb is G 8460, located in the Central Field, which is part of the Giza Necropolis.[1] The entrance leads to a rock-cut chapel. Two pillars divide the chapel into two parts. In the area behind the pillars three burial shafts are dug into the floor.
